content: crocheted catnip octopus designed by kristina k miller july 2020 materials needed red heart super saver acrylic yarn any color black yarn for eyes crochet hook - size f or g catnip fiberfill stuffing yarn needle arms be sure to leave around 6 yarn before you start your chain for the first arm below because you will use this to close up the body at the end arm 1 chain 16 starting in 2nd chain from end and working in the back loop only 5 single_crochet 8 half_double_crochet 2 double_crochet arm should have a natural twist arms 2-8 without cutting the yarn repeat steps for arm 1 seven more times you will have eight curly arms all in a row join the arms into a circle with a slip_stitch in the first chain of the first arm head and body working from the arms in continuous rounds without turning round 1 work 2 single_crochet through the double_crochet at the base of each arm 16 sts round 2 *1 single_crochet in each of next 2 sts work 2 single_crochet together* 4 times 12 sts round 3 - 4 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 12 sts round 5 *1 single_crochet in each of next 2 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in 3rd single_crochet* 4 times 16 sts round 6 *1 single_crochet in each of next 3 single_crochet 2 single_crochet in 4th single_crochet* 4 times 20 sts round 7 - 8 single_crochet in each single_crochet around 20 sts round 9 *1 single_crochet in each of next 3 single_crochet work 2 single_crochet together* 4 times 16 sts round 10 *1 single_crochet in each of next 2 single_crochet work 2 single_crochet together* 4 times 12 sts round 11 *1 single_crochet in next single_crochet work 2 single_crochet together* 4 times 8 sts round 12 *work 2 single_crochet together* 4 times 4 sts finish off by cutting a 4 or 5 tail of yarn and weave the yarn tail through the loops of the 4 remaining sts and tightly pull up to securely close top of the ball pull up a loop in the end and pull yarn tail through fasten_off trim yarn tail if needed and pull yarn tail into the body add two eyes at the bottom of the body using black yarn you can do this before you stuff or after begin stuffing the body firmly with fiberfill add a teaspoon of catnip and cover with more fiberfill until the body is full using the beginning yarn tail thread it around the bottom in a loop at the narrowest point where the body meets the arms and pull until you close the opening if needed add a few additional back & forth stitches to make it solid fasten_off and pull remaining yarn tail into the body give each arm a final pull so that it curls back naturally stitches used chain=chain single_crochet=single_crochet double_crochet=double_crochet half_double_crochet=half_double_crochet st=stitch work 2 single_crochet together single_crochet decrease = insert hook into st and draw up a loop insert hook into next st
